channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree limb across single track road., 9th June
item.description:
Limb of willow tree fallen across the road. Currently propped up by hitting another tree on opposite side of the road. Leaning more now and could be difficult for emergency vehicles to pass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langley Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Pavement outside entrance to Sixways Clinic/Car Park is difficult for people to walk on, 9th June
item.description:
The pavement on the London Road at the entrance to Sixways Clinic/Sixways Car Park is difficult for people with mobility issues to navigate due to the numerous patches and broken surface. It is a lunar landscape that people have to walk across. In addition the road markings are badly faded at this point and the 'Keep' in the 'Keep Clear' no longer exists due to the road surface it was painted on having broken up. This area of pavement and the road markings need renewing. Lots of elderly people use it to access Sixways Clinic and many are struggling to navigate it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakhurst Rise, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing drain cover - on the entrance to the underpass, 9th June
item.description:
The underpass joining B4063 to GL3 1JZ. There's a missing drain cover which would easily catch a bike wheel.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: The whole road and pavement is disgraceful, full of pot holes and uneven surfaces. This is one of the oldest roads in Cheltenham with lots of investment being made on the road. item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Streetlight out, 9th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Raised ridge in the road causing people to fall, 8th June
item.description:
It is on the A4015 Montpellier Walk coming out of Cheltenham near the Rotunda bus stop. There is a raised longitudinal ridge in the road, 4-6 inches high. I tripped over it and hurt myself, a couple of minutes later a lady tripped over it and fell onto the raised kerb injuring her shoulder. It is extremely dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks sign STILL dumped on pavement, 8th June
item.description:
Originally reported on 4th March. Ref. 5665533 Were originally 2 signs (see photo) - one disappeared a few weeks later, but other sign still there (lent against tree) 3 months later. STILL needs removing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overton Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Lots of loose large stones and rubble covering the exit and roundabout edging, 8th June
item.description:
Something has tipped a large amount of stones and rocks across the exit from Hayfield Way onto the roundabout causing issues for cyclists and motorcyclists in the area. Loose rocks like this are deadly for those on two wheels as this can cause skidding at any moment. Please could this be swept up, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously high grass and vegetation blocking view for drivers and cyclists leaving Coberley onto A435, 8th June
item.description:
The vegetation around the Bus Shelter and on the side of the road for approx 100 yards in the direction of Cirencester on the A435 Coberley junction. Drivers cannot see over the vegetation and there have been serious near misses this last week with drivers pulling out onto a 60 mph road with no visibility.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
